final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 significant figures based on current (1.50 A) and time (30.0 min) data.

method: Convert time to seconds: 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Charge passed Q = I×t = 1.50×1800 = 2700 C. Using Faraday constant F = 96,500 C mol-1, moles of electrons passed is n(e−)=Q/F=2700/96500=0.02798 mol. From Cu2+ + 2e− -> Cu, 2 mol e− deposit 1 mol Cu, so n(Cu)=0.02798/2=0.01399 mol. Using Ar(Cu)=63.55 g mol-1, mass deposited m = n×Ar = 0.01399×63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Order-of-magnitude: 2700 C is ~0.028 mol e−, so Cu moles ~0.014 mol giving < 1 g Cu; result 0.889 g fits.
Stoichiometry check: dividing electron moles by 2 matches the 2e− in the given half-equation.
